page.title: 02INTRODUCTION-Houses/Villages
page.content: The main urban area to the east of the A19 includes the outer suburbs of Sunderland. A mixture of housing exists from the older established semi-rural village of East Herrington to the mixed council and private housing of Grindon, the former being built immediately post war and the latter from the 1960's onwards. The small villages to the west lie equidistant from the larger towns of Sunderland, Washington and Houghton-le -Spring and have grown together over the years to form a small hub of urban settlement.All but Penshaw owe their origin to "King Coal" and the Industrial Revolution. Today there can be seen one of the last remaining deep coalmines on the Durham Coalfield at Herrington and the remains of older long since dissused pits can still be found in this area.
